page.title: List of Irish counties' coats of arms

rev.comment: rm non-free images in list article per [[WP:NFLISTS]]
rev.diff:
Line 1: Line 1: â
{{non-free}}
 
The following is a list of '''Irish counties' coats of arms'''. In the majority of cases these are arms assigned to [[county council]]s created by the [[Local Government (Ireland) Act 1898]] or later legislation, either by the [[Chief Herald of Ireland]] in what is now the [[Republic of Ireland]] or the [[College of Arms]] in [[Northern Ireland]].
The following is a list of '''Irish counties' coats of arms'''. In the majority of cases these are arms assigned to [[county council]]s created by the [[Local Government (Ireland) Act 1898]] or later legislation, either by the [[Chief Herald of Ireland]] in what is now the [[Republic of Ireland]] or the [[College of Arms]] in [[Northern Ireland]].
Line 50: Line 49:
Became obsolete in 1994 on division into Dun Laoghaire-Rathdown, Fingal and South Dublin.
Became obsolete in 1994 on division into Dun Laoghaire-Rathdown, Fingal and South Dublin.

â
| [[File:FingalCrest.png|100px|border]] || [[Fingal]] || Vert a raven on a hurdle proper, in chief in the dexter a St. Brigidâs cross and in the sinister a garb Or, on a point enhanced in base argent on waves of the sea in base of four azure and of the fourth a Viking longship sail set also proper, with the motto: ''FlÃºirse Talaimh is Mara'' (Abundance of Land and Sea).<br/> Granted to Fingal Area Committee 26 November 1993.<ref name=register/>
+
| <!-- Do not place a non-free image here --> || [[Fingal]] || Vert a raven on a hurdle proper, in chief in the dexter a St. Brigidâs cross and in the sinister a garb Or, on a point enhanced in base argent on waves of the sea in base of four azure and of the fourth a Viking longship sail set also proper, with the motto: ''FlÃºirse Talaimh is Mara'' (Abundance of Land and Sea).<br/> Granted to Fingal Area Committee 26 November 1993.<ref name=register/>

| [[File:DL-RathdownCrest.png|100px|border]] || [[Dun Laoghaire-Rathdown]] || Per chevron argent and vert, in chief an ancient Irish crown proper between in the dexter a slip of oak of the second fructed of the third [=proper] and in the sinister a trefoil slipped also of the second, in base on waves of the sea barry wavy of four of the first and azure a Viking longship sail set oars in action also proper, motto: ''Ã Chuan go Sliabh'' (From Harbour to Mountain).<br/> Granted to Dun Laoghaire â Rathdown Area Committee 7 December 1993.<ref name=register/>
+
| <!-- Do not place a non-free image here --> || [[Dun Laoghaire-Rathdown]] || Per chevron argent and vert, in chief an ancient Irish crown proper between in the dexter a slip of oak of the second fructed of the third [=proper] and in the sinister a trefoil slipped also of the second, in base on waves of the sea barry wavy of four of the first and azure a Viking longship sail set oars in action also proper, motto: ''Ã Chuan go Sliabh'' (From Harbour to Mountain).<br/> Granted to Dun Laoghaire â Rathdown Area Committee 7 December 1993.<ref name=register/>

â
| [[File:South Dublin County Council Crest.JPG|100px|border]] || [[South Dublin]] || Argent two barrulets dancettÃ© vert between as many bars wavy azure in chief an open book proper garnished or the dexter page charged with a Celtic cross gules and in base a fret couped sable with the mottoes: ''This We Hold in Trust'' and above ''Ag Seo Ãr gCÃºram''.<br/> Granted to South Dublin Area Committee 29 June 1993.<ref name=register/>
+
| <!-- Do not place a non-free image here --> || [[South Dublin]] || Argent two barrulets dancettÃ© vert between as many bars wavy azure in chief an open book proper garnished or the dexter page charged with a Celtic cross gules and in base a fret couped sable with the mottoes: ''This We Hold in Trust'' and above ''Ag Seo Ãr gCÃºram''.<br/> Granted to South Dublin Area Committee 29 June 1993.<ref name=register/>

â
| [[File:KildareCrest.png|100px|border]] || [[County Kildare|Kildare]] || Argent on a saltire gules between in chief a saint Brigid's cross vert in base a sprig of oak of the last fructed proper and in fess in the dexter a harp and in the sinister a horse's head erased, both of the last, two swords in saltire points upward gold, with the motto: ''Meanma agus Misneach'' (Spirit and Courage).<br/> Granted 19 July 1991.<ref name=register/>
+
| <!-- Do not place a non-free image here --> || [[County Kildare|Kildare]] || Argent on a saltire gules between in chief a saint Brigid's cross vert in base a sprig of oak of the last fructed proper and in fess in the dexter a harp and in the sinister a horse's head erased, both of the last, two swords in saltire points upward gold, with the motto: ''Meanma agus Misneach'' (Spirit and Courage).<br/> Granted 19 July 1991.<ref name=register/>
|-
|-
| [[File:Kilkenny County Crest.svg|100px|border]] || [[County Kilkenny|Kilkenny]] || Ermine a fess party per pale dexter sable three garbs argent sinister quarterly 1st and 4th argent 2nd and 3rd gules a fret Or.<br/> Recorded as Arms of County Kilkenny circa 1665.<ref name=carney/>
| [[File:Kilkenny County Crest.svg|100px|border]] || [[County Kilkenny|Kilkenny]] || Ermine a fess party per pale dexter sable three garbs argent sinister quarterly 1st and 4th argent 2nd and 3rd gules a fret Or.<br/> Recorded as Arms of County Kilkenny circa 1665.<ref name=carney/>

| [[File:Louth Co Co.jpeg|100px|border]] || [[County Louth|Louth]] || Vert a bezant charged with a dexter hand aversant couped at the wrist proper, on a chief sable two ancient ships sails set argent, with the Crest: Between two ears of barley or conjoined at the base a sword erect point downwards proper and with the motto: ''Lugh sÃ¡imh-ioldÃ¡nach'' ([[Lugh]] equally skilled in many arts).<br/> Certified 9 June 1977.<ref name=register/>

| [[File:Meath coa.jpg|100px|border]] || [[County Meath|Meath]] || Per pile enarched reversed vert and azure fimbriated argent, at the fess point an antique crown or in chief in the dexter a spiral, in the sinister a Celtic cross and in base a salmon naiant all of the third, the whole within a bordure gold with the motto: ''TrÃ© Neart le ChÃ©ile'' (Together Strong).<br/> Granted 16 September 1988.<ref name=register/>

| [[File:Offaly co co.jpg|100px|border]] || [[County Offaly|Offaly]] || Tierced in fess vert, argent and or, a lion rampant holding between the paws a cross patÃ©e concave all of the last, the cross within an annulet of the second, on a point pointed in base sable a sprig of Andromeda polifolia proper, with the motto: ''ESTO FIDELIS'' (Be Faithful).<br/> Granted 31 August 1983.<ref name=register/>
+
| <!-- Do not place a non-free image here --> || [[County Offaly|Offaly]] || Tierced in fess vert, argent and or, a lion rampant holding between the paws a cross patÃ©e concave all of the last, the cross within an annulet of the second, on a point pointed in base sable a sprig of Andromeda polifolia proper, with the motto: ''ESTO FIDELIS'' (Be Faithful).<br/> Granted 31 August 1983.<ref name=register/>

| [[File:Westmeath logo 01.JPG|100px|border]] || [[County Westmeath|Westmeath]] || Per saltire azure and gules, in the fess point an annulet between two lions rampant and respecting each other all or, in chief a swan swimming and in base a Norse helmet both proper, with the motto: ''Triath Ã³s Triathaibh'' (Noble above nobility).<br/> Certified 7 August 1968.<ref name=register/>
| [[File:Westmeath logo 01.JPG|100px|border]] || [[County Westmeath|Westmeath]] || Per saltire azure and gules, in the fess point an annulet between two lions rampant and respecting each other all or, in chief a swan swimming and in base a Norse helmet both proper, with the motto: ''Triath Ã³s Triathaibh'' (Noble above nobility).<br/> Certified 7 August 1968.<ref name=register/>

| [[File:IRL COA County Wexford 3D.svg|100px|border]] || [[County Wexford|Wexford]] || Per bend purpure and or, on a band wavy argent between in chief a lion rampant holding in the paws a pike of the last and on rocks in base a representation of the Hook Lighthouse all proper, two spear heads bendwise points upwards also proper, with the motto: ''Exemplar Hiberniae'' (An example to Ireland).<br/>Granted 19 July 1988.<ref name=register/>
| [[File:IRL COA County Wexford 3D.svg|100px|border]] || [[County Wexford|Wexford]] || Per bend purpure and or, on a band wavy argent between in chief a lion rampant holding in the paws a pike of the last and on rocks in base a representation of the Hook Lighthouse all proper, two spear heads bendwise points upwards also proper, with the motto: ''Exemplar Hiberniae'' (An example to Ireland).<br/>Granted 19 July 1988.<ref name=register/>

| [[File:WicklowCrest.png|100px|border]] || [[County Wicklow|Wicklow]] || Per fess dancetÃ©e azure and vert, in chief a lion passant to the sinister reguardant Or between two oak branches proper, in base a representation of St. Kevin's Church at Glendalough proper with the motto: ''Meanma Saor'' (Free Spirits).<br/> Certified 1 August 1956.<ref name=register/>

Line 87: Line 86:
| [[File:Clarecocologo.png|100px|border]] || [[County Clare|Clare]] || Per fesse dancetÃ©e azure and or on a pale counter-changed between in chief in the dexter a rose and in the sinister an antique crown of the second and in base in the dexter an annulet rayonÃ©e and in the sinister a stagâs head erased gules, in chief a tau cross proper and in base a pile reversed of the second fleuried at the point argent; a point pointed barry wavy of the last and of the first and with the motto: ''DÃ­lis d'ar nOidhreacht'' (True to our heritage).<br/>Granted 6 September 1985.<ref name=register/>
| [[File:Clarecocologo.png|100px|border]] || [[County Clare|Clare]] || Per fesse dancetÃ©e azure and or on a pale counter-changed between in chief in the dexter a rose and in the sinister an antique crown of the second and in base in the dexter an annulet rayonÃ©e and in the sinister a stagâs head erased gules, in chief a tau cross proper and in base a pile reversed of the second fleuried at the point argent; a point pointed barry wavy of the last and of the first and with the motto: ''DÃ­lis d'ar nOidhreacht'' (True to our heritage).<br/>Granted 6 September 1985.<ref name=register/>
|-
|-
â
| [[Image:CorkCountycrest.png|100px|border]] || [[County Cork|Cork]] || The county council has no arms. The seal was adopted in 1899: In the centre are the arms of Cork City. The other six shields are arms of towns in the county, although none have been officially recorded. These represent Youghal, Castlemartyr, Bandon, Midleton, Kinsale and Charleville.<ref>''Cork County Guide'', c.1990</ref>
+
| <!-- Do not place a non-free image here --> || [[County Cork|Cork]] || The county council has no arms. The seal was adopted in 1899: In the centre are the arms of Cork City. The other six shields are arms of towns in the county, although none have been officially recorded. These represent Youghal, Castlemartyr, Bandon, Midleton, Kinsale and Charleville.<ref>''Cork County Guide'', c.1990</ref>
|-
|-
| [[Image:Kerrycocologo.png|100px|border]] || [[County Kerry|Kerry]] || Per fess vert and or a fess indented point in point argent and azure between in chief an antique crown of the second between two cross crosslets fitchÃ©e of the third and in base a representation of the boat of St. Brendan of the first, with the motto: ''Comhar, Cabhair, Cairdeas'' (Co-operation, Help, Friendship).<br/> Granted 12 April 1984.<ref name=register/>
| [[Image:Kerrycocologo.png|100px|border]] || [[County Kerry|Kerry]] || Per fess vert and or a fess indented point in point argent and azure between in chief an antique crown of the second between two cross crosslets fitchÃ©e of the third and in base a representation of the boat of St. Brendan of the first, with the motto: ''Comhar, Cabhair, Cairdeas'' (Co-operation, Help, Friendship).<br/> Granted 12 April 1984.<ref name=register/>
|-
|-

| [[Image:County Limerick Council.JPG|100px|border]] || [[County Limerick|Limerick]] || Vert three pallets wavy argent, a cross patÃ©e convexed within an annulet Or, with the crest: A figure of [[Patrick Sarsfield]], the right hand grasping a sword, the left hand outstretched and pointing, all proper and with the motto: ''Cuimhnigh ar Luimneach'' (Remember Limerick).<br/> Certified 24 May 1976.
+
| <!-- Do not place a non-free image here --> || [[County Limerick|Limerick]] || Vert three pallets wavy argent, a cross patÃ©e convexed within an annulet Or, with the crest: A figure of [[Patrick Sarsfield]], the right hand grasping a sword, the left hand outstretched and pointing, all proper and with the motto: ''Cuimhnigh ar Luimneach'' (Remember Limerick).<br/> Certified 24 May 1976.

| [[Image:IRL county Tipperary COA.png|100px|border]] || [[County Tipperary]] || Ermine a fesse quarterly 1 and 4 Or a chief indented azure 2 and 3 gules three covered cups gold.<br> Recorded as Arms of County Tipperary c.1665.<ref name=carney/> <br> These arms became obsolete when the county was divided in 1838.
| [[Image:IRL county Tipperary COA.png|100px|border]] || [[County Tipperary]] || Ermine a fesse quarterly 1 and 4 Or a chief indented azure 2 and 3 gules three covered cups gold.<br> Recorded as Arms of County Tipperary c.1665.<ref name=carney/> <br> These arms became obsolete when the county was divided in 1838.

| [[Image:SouthTipperaryCrest.png|100px|border]] || [[South Tipperary]] || Per fess ermine and barry wavy of six argent and azure, a fess quarterly, first and fourth quarters or a chief indented azure, second and third quarters gules three covered cups or, and in base three salmon naiant two and one proper, with the crest: A lion couchant or langued gules and with the motto: ''Vallis Aurea Suirensis'' (The Golden Vale of the [[River Suir|Suir]]).<br/>Granted to Tipperary South Riding County Council 6 July 1990.
+
| <!-- Do not place a non-free image here --> || [[South Tipperary]] || Per fess ermine and barry wavy of six argent and azure, a fess quarterly, first and fourth quarters or a chief indented azure, second and third quarters gules three covered cups or, and in base three salmon naiant two and one proper, with the crest: A lion couchant or langued gules and with the motto: ''Vallis Aurea Suirensis'' (The Golden Vale of the [[River Suir|Suir]]).<br/>Granted to Tipperary South Riding County Council 6 July 1990.

| [[Image:Waterfordcrest.png|100px|border]] || [[County Waterford|Waterford]] || Azure on a pile reversed throughout argent, between in the dexter an eagleâs head erased of the second holding in the beak three stalks of wheat or and in the sinister a stagâs head erased also of the second holding in the beak three stalks of wheat or and in the sinister a stagâs head erased also of the second thereon between the attires a Latin cross of the third, a representation of the round tower of Ardmore proper, on a point in base barry-wavy of six of the first and second a lymphad, sail set, oars in action, flags flying gold with the motto: ''DÃ©isi oc DeclÃ¡n co BrÃ¡th'' (May the [[DÃ©ise]] remain with [[Declan]] forever).<br/>Granted 4 February 1997.
+
| <!-- Do not place a non-free image here --> || [[County Waterford|Waterford]] || Azure on a pile reversed throughout argent, between in the dexter an eagleâs head erased of the second holding in the beak three stalks of wheat or and in the sinister a stagâs head erased also of the second holding in the beak three stalks of wheat or and in the sinister a stagâs head erased also of the second thereon between the attires a Latin cross of the third, a representation of the round tower of Ardmore proper, on a point in base barry-wavy of six of the first and second a lymphad, sail set, oars in action, flags flying gold with the motto: ''DÃ©isi oc DeclÃ¡n co BrÃ¡th'' (May the [[DÃ©ise]] remain with [[Declan]] forever).<br/>Granted 4 February 1997.

Line 114: Line 113:
| [[File:Armagh arms.svg|100px|border]] || [[County Armagh|Armagh]] (NI) || County Armagh has never received a grant of arms. Traditionally the reputed arms of the City of [[Armagh]] were used. These were a blue shield bearing a gold harp (the arms of Ireland). It has been suggested that Armagh used these arms as it is the ecclesiastical capital of Ireland. Sometimes the field of the arms has been depicted as green, identical to the arms of the Province of Leinster. These arms have appeared upon Northern Ireland bank notes representing the county.<ref>Nicholas Williams, ''Armas â SracfhÃ©achaint ar Araltas na hÃireann'', Howth, 2001</ref>
| [[File:Armagh arms.svg|100px|border]] || [[County Armagh|Armagh]] (NI) || County Armagh has never received a grant of arms. Traditionally the reputed arms of the City of [[Armagh]] were used. These were a blue shield bearing a gold harp (the arms of Ireland). It has been suggested that Armagh used these arms as it is the ecclesiastical capital of Ireland. Sometimes the field of the arms has been depicted as green, identical to the arms of the Province of Leinster. These arms have appeared upon Northern Ireland bank notes representing the county.<ref>Nicholas Williams, ''Armas â SracfhÃ©achaint ar Araltas na hÃireann'', Howth, 2001</ref>
|-
|-
â

With the motto: ''Feardhacht is FÃ­rinne'' (Manliness and Truth).<br/> Certified by Chief Herald 20 September 1979.<ref name=register/>
+

| [[Image:Donegalcocologo.png|100px|border]] || [[County Donegal|Donegal]] || Barry wavy of eight vert and or, on an inescutcheon ermine a cross crosslet fitchÃ©e gules, with the Crest: In front of four quill pens erect points downwards or a dove proper, mantled gules doubled argent with the Motto: ''Mutuam habeatis caritatem'' ((Maintain among you) Mutual love or charity) and with the Badge: A cross crosslet fitchÃ©e gules enfiled with a lunula points upwards or.<br/> Certified by Chief Herald 20 May 1974.<ref name=register/>
| [[Image:Donegalcocologo.png|100px|border]] || [[County Donegal|Donegal]] || Barry wavy of eight vert and or, on an inescutcheon ermine a cross crosslet fitchÃ©e gules, with the Crest: In front of four quill pens erect points downwards or a dove proper, mantled gules doubled argent with the Motto: ''Mutuam habeatis caritatem'' ((Maintain among you) Mutual love or charity) and with the Badge: A cross crosslet fitchÃ©e gules enfiled with a lunula points upwards or.<br/> Certified by Chief Herald 20 May 1974.<ref name=register/>
Line 124: Line 123:
| [[Image:Lderry co arms.png|100px|border]] || [[County Londonderry|Londonderry]] (NI) || Per chevron Gules and Or, in chief a flax flower proper between two garbs of the second, in base a dexter hand appaumÃ©e couped at the wrist of the first; the shield ensigned with a mural crown gold. Supporters: On either side a sea dragon argent, each charged on the wing with a cross Gules and wreathed about the neck with a garland of oak stalked and leaved and fructed proper. Motto: ''Auxilium A Domino'' (Help comes from the Lord).<br/> Granted by Garter and Norroy & Ulster 1 February 1951.<ref name=briggs/>
| [[Image:Lderry co arms.png|100px|border]] || [[County Londonderry|Londonderry]] (NI) || Per chevron Gules and Or, in chief a flax flower proper between two garbs of the second, in base a dexter hand appaumÃ©e couped at the wrist of the first; the shield ensigned with a mural crown gold. Supporters: On either side a sea dragon argent, each charged on the wing with a cross Gules and wreathed about the neck with a garland of oak stalked and leaved and fructed proper. Motto: ''Auxilium A Domino'' (Help comes from the Lord).<br/> Granted by Garter and Norroy & Ulster 1 February 1951.<ref name=briggs/>

â
| [[Image:Co Monaghan arms.jpg|100px|border]] || [[County Monaghan|Monaghan]] || Per pale azure and argent, in the dexter an ancient Irish shield or and in the sinister a horseâs head erased sable; on a chief per pale of the second and of the first, in the dexter a sword in bend sinister point upwards proper and in the sinister an ancient Irish drinking cup of the third and with the Motto: ''DÃºthracht agus DÃ­cheall'' (Diligence and Best Endeavour).<br/> Granted by chief Herald 10 January 1984.<ref name=register/>
+
| <!-- Do not place a non-free image here --> || [[County Monaghan|Monaghan]] || Per pale azure and argent, in the dexter an ancient Irish shield or and in the sinister a horseâs head erased sable; on a chief per pale of the second and of the first, in the dexter a sword in bend sinister point upwards proper and in the sinister an ancient Irish drinking cup of the third and with the Motto: ''DÃºthracht agus DÃ­cheall'' (Diligence and Best Endeavour).<br/> Granted by chief Herald 10 January 1984.<ref name=register/>
|-

| [[Image:Tyrone arms.png|100px|border]] || [[County Tyrone|Tyrone]] (NI) || Per fesse indented Sable and Argent, in chief a mullet of eight points of the second charged with a fleur-de-lys of the first, in base a dexter hand appaumÃ©e Gules. Crest: On a wreath Argent and Gules, On a mount and in front of a castle of two towers, a hurst, issuant from the battlements of the castle a dexter arm embowed in armour, the hand grasping a sword in bend sinister, all proper. Supporters: On either side a lion rampant, that to the dexter Or gorged with a ribbon, pendent therefrom an escutcheon Argent charged with a cross Gules, and that to the sinister Gules gorged with a ribbon Argent, pendent therefrom an escutcheon Azure charged with a saltire also Argent. Motto: ''Consilio et Prudentia'' (By Wisdom and Prudence).<br/> Granted by Garter and Norroy & Ulster 24 May 1951.<ref name=briggs/>
| [[Image:Tyrone arms.png|100px|border]] || [[County Tyrone|Tyrone]] (NI) || Per fesse indented Sable and Argent, in chief a mullet of eight points of the second charged with a fleur-de-lys of the first, in base a dexter hand appaumÃ©e Gules. Crest: On a wreath Argent and Gules, On a mount and in front of a castle of two towers, a hurst, issuant from the battlements of the castle a dexter arm embowed in armour, the hand grasping a sword in bend sinister, all proper. Supporters: On either side a lion rampant, that to the dexter Or gorged with a ribbon, pendent therefrom an escutcheon Argent charged with a cross Gules, and that to the sinister Gules gorged with a ribbon Argent, pendent therefrom an escutcheon Azure charged with a saltire also Argent. Motto: ''Consilio et Prudentia'' (By Wisdom and Prudence).<br/> Granted by Garter and Norroy & Ulster 24 May 1951.<ref name=briggs/>
